Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial on Remote Expert Instructional Feedback in Endovascular Simulation-Based Education

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to two groups

Participants.evidence: 12 vascular surgery residents in Ireland, ranging from second to seventh year of residency

Intervention.evidence: Group 1 received in-person feedback first, followed by remote feedback, while Group 2 received remote feedback first, followed by in-person feedback

Objective.evidence: evaluates the effectiveness of remote expert instructional feedback in endovascular simulation-based education

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the effectiveness of remote feedback, assessed through interviews and a validated questionnaire post-training

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved through a crossover design, and allocation concealment was not specified

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not implemented for participants or outcome assessors

Result_Outcome.evidence: The questionnaire results showed no significant difference between remote and in-person feedback

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported during the study
